alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clark; Juneau; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 9:42PM CST until December 27 at 9:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Slippery Conditions in Snow, Wintry Mix... .Many roads across southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa and western Wisconsin are snow-covered or slippery as snow continues to move across the region, with areas of wintry mix in spots. About 1/2 inches has fallen. Snow will continue to shift north and east through the late evening, gradually diminishing with a transition to freezing drizzle or drizzle. The snow or wintry mix, combined with winds gusting 30 to 40 mph and visibility reduced to under 1 mile or less at times will lead to slick travel overnight. Slow down and allow plenty of time to reach your destination if driving. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Juneau, Adams, Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
